file_content.text: Whoa, whoa, not so fast, Sergeant--you and me need to have a little talk.
What can I do for you?
As you wish, sir.
Something you need from me?
What's this about?
I'm Lieutenant Virk. I think maybe you've heard of me? See, my boys here saw you having a chat with little Ensign Farn.
I'm on Havoc Squad business, grunt. Don't slow me down.
Get out of my way.
Grunt? I'm Lieutenant Virk, Sergeant--and I think you know who I am. My boys saw you chatting away with Ensign Farn.
I know Farn told you about my business, and I know you went and blabbed about it to some very important people.
And now, I got a mountain of paperwork to do, hearings to go to, people asking questions--and I don't like that.
You're extorting your own men, Virk.
You brought this on yourself.
No. I have one person to blame for these problems--you.
Not everyone on Ord Mantell is interested in making you happy.
I don't care what you like.
Maybe not everyone cares, but the ones who want to make it home some day sure do.
You can't handle the stress, swallow a grenade, do us all a favor.
There's always suicide.
If anybody's gonna end up dead around here, it isn't gonna be me.
Wise up. This island is my little kingdom--I can make sure people live, and I can make sure they die.
So you better believe that I'm going to make extra sure you come home from your next assignment in a box. Sergeant.
If you're finished threatening me, I have places to be, Lieutenant.
Are we done here?
Dangerous places, I bet. Places where no one will think twice if you turn up dead.
I'm not afraid of you.
You don't have to be scared for accidents to happen.
I think we're done here, boys. Let's move out.
We could settle this right here, Virk. Or are you afraid of me?
I'll take you on right now.
Afraid? I ain't afraid of you! If you wanna die so bad, then let's make it happen! Lock and load, boys--we're taking this punk down!
Now, I know Farn told you about my business. But you've kept it quiet, which means you got character. Discretion, you know? I like people with character and discretion.
Now, fine soldierly qualities like those ought to be rewarded. A salary bonus, maybe. Hear what I'm saying?
Thank you very much, sir! A bonus would really help me out.
That'd be great!
Just how big of a "bonus" are we talking about, here, Lieutenant?
Keep talking, I'm listening.
Big enough to make you feel very, very appreciated.
A nice, fat salary bonus, "in honor of your meritorious service to our fine Republic." Yeah, that sounds nice.
That's very generous, sir. Thank you very much.
I agree.
I'd love to get a commendation--I've never gotten one before.
Do I get a medal, too?
This girl's not too bright, is she?
Heh, is this guy simple or something?
Shut it, Jarix. Unfortunately, there's no medal, Sergeant, because it's a top secret commendation. Real hush-hush.
Here you go, then, Sergeant. Keep up your fine service to the Republic and your fellow soldiers. Let's go, boys!
You must be pretty scared if you're trying to buy me off.
Sounds desperate to me.
I'm not scared of you, Sergeant. I was just hoping that nothing terrible would have to happen here.
You can't bribe me, Virk.
Careful, Sergeant, you're making me think you might still go and blab about my affairs. You don't wanna do that.
I won't tell anyone what you're doing, but I won't take your credits, either.
I don't rat out my comrades.
I know how to mind my own business. So you just mind yours.
Just leave me alone, okay?
Fine. Just don't change your mind and start talking about my business, or we're going to have a problem.
Let's move out, boys!
I'm gonna burn you the next chance I get.
You're going down, Lieutenant.
Don't be an idiot. I've got good credits here, and all you have to do to get them is to keep your mouth shut.
If you don't take what I'm offering, I'll have to find a much less pleasant way to keep you quiet.
I'll keep quiet. I don't want any trouble.
Okay, I'll take the offer.
Smart lady.
Smart man.
Here you go, then, soldier. See that you continue to show such admirable discretion. Let's go, boys!
You think I got into Havoc Squad by being a coward, Virk?
I'm not afraid of you.
Well, it obviously wasn't by being smart, Sergeant.
Go ahead, Virk. Show me how unpleasant you can be.
Bring it on.
Oh, Sergeant. I was hoping I wouldn't have to resort to anything drastic, but you aren't giving me a choice.
All right, boys, time to go to work--and make sure nobody recognizes the body.
Whoa, boss, are you sure? I mean, we're right in the middle of the fort, someone might hear--
So turn on the sonic damper field--that's what we got it for! And somebody shoot this punk!
Yes, sir!
Get lost.
